lexUnit.name: discourage.v

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: FN: to dissuade (usually followed by 'from'), and/or to deprive of confidence; dishearten

sentence.text: As teachers you can direct them along fruitful lines of approach and discourage them from fruitless ones .
While he was in no position to read her the Riot Act , it was plain commonsense to discourage her from her present ways .
If this occurs , try to contain such behaviour by discouraging anyone from sexual activity or from exposing themselves in public .
So he did n't actually discourage me from doing it , he was just slightly disappointed , I think ( Tanya )
Our neighbours , with whom we drank Metaxa and broke plates most evenings , thought they were trying to discourage tourists from venturing into the mountains because of the risk .

In a way , this attitude is similar to that of those who in earlier centuries discouraged scientific investigation by saying that all natural phenomena were the work of God and should not be inquired into .
Eva made no effort to have us talk to each other , Shadwell and I ; in fact I felt she wanted to discourage conversation .
Sitting behind the wheel of the Lagonda , he tried to understand why the old man had discouraged him .
More often than not the women declined , but this did not discourage the tipsy men .
But Cicero told one of his correspondents that he had been discouraged by his elders and betters from attending such a school : " continebar autem doctissimorum hominum auctoritate " ( Suet .

Members were discouraged from bringing along a personal caddie and if they did they still had to pay the caddie master the fee he would have received , irrespective of whether there was a caddie available or not !
Russia was an information vacuum , in which questions were positively discouraged .
Potential candidates may be discouraged from running less by the congressional salary than by the prospect of defeat at the hands of a Democratic opponent .
Their complaint : the system discourages working because unemployment provides benefits that many entry - level jobs do n't include .
